stories.title: BetrFS, file system that uses Bε trees
User type needs – most of us are socialisers

stories.text:
Here by "message bus" I mean this EIP pattern: https://www.enterpriseintegrationpatterns.com/MessageBus.html . Message bus is not equal to message broker. It's not really EDA. It's just a way of system interaction.

According to my research, Message Bus pattern kind of inspired ESB (or is highly related to). ESB has failed, because IBM guys make it a huge middleware that's complicated and expensive.

But Message Bus in my opinion is still a great pattern and can still help a lot in modern microservices architecture. Its "mediator" nature and "common data structure" can improve loose-coupling of a microservice ecosystem, and make things more understandable.

Sadly it seems it's not very popular nowadays per my googling. Message-based communication in microservcies is very popular, but "common data structure" is not used. For most architectures there is no concept of "bus", even if pub/sub is used as the major way of messaging.

I can see Apache Camel is still popular. But I found few examples of people using it for message bus.

This is just my impression. I'd love to hear different ideas.
stories.title: Discuss HN: Message Bus (EIP Pattern) is not popular, is it?
